attached_deposit.description:
Optionally, attach deposit to [`.on_auth`](::defuse_auth_call::AuthCallee::on_auth) call. The amount will be subtracted from user's NEP-141 `wNEAR` balance.

NOTE: the `wNEAR` will not be refunded in case of fail.

contract_id.description: Callee for [`.on_auth`](::defuse_auth_call::AuthCallee::on_auth)

min_gas.description:
Optional minimum gas required for created promise to succeed. By default, only [`MIN_GAS_DEFAULT`](AuthCall::MIN_GAS_DEFAULT) is required.

Remaining gas will be distributed evenly across all Function Call Promises created during execution of current receipt.

msg.description: `msg` to pass in [`.on_auth`](::defuse_auth_call::AuthCallee::on_auth)

state_init.description: Optionally initialize the receiver's contract (Deterministic AccountId) via [`state_init`](https://github.com/near/NEPs/blob/master/neps/nep-0616.md#stateinit-action) right before calling [`.on_auth()`](::defuse_auth_call::AuthCallee::on_auth) (in the same receipt).

account_id.description:
NEAR Account Identifier.

This is a unique, syntactically valid, human-readable account identifier on the NEAR network.

[See the crate-level docs for information about validation.](index.html#account-id-rules)

Also see [Error kind precedence](AccountId#error-kind-precedence).

## Examples

``` use near_account_id::AccountId;

let alice: AccountId = "alice.near".parse().unwrap();

assert!("ƒelicia.near".parse::<AccountId>().is_err()); // (ƒ is not f) ```

intents.description: Sequence of intents to execute in given order. Empty list is also a valid sequence, i.e. it doesn't do anything, but still invalidates the `nonce` for the signer WARNING: Promises created by different intents are executed concurrently and does not rely on the order of the intents in this structure

min_gas.description:
Optional minimum required Near gas for created Promise to succeed: * `ft_transfer`:      minimum: 15TGas, default: 15TGas * `ft_transfer_call`: minimum: 30TGas, default: 50TGas

Remaining gas will be distributed evenly across all Function Call Promises created during execution of current receipt.

msg.description: Message to pass to `ft_transfer_call`. Otherwise, `ft_transfer` will be used. NOTE: No refund will be made in case of insufficient `storage_deposit` on `token` for `receiver_id`

attached_deposit.description:
Optionally, attach deposit to [`.on_auth`](::defuse_auth_call::AuthCallee::on_auth) call. The amount will be subtracted from user's NEP-141 `wNEAR` balance.

NOTE: the `wNEAR` will not be refunded in case of fail.

MtWithdraw.description:
Withdraw given MT tokens (i.e. [NEP-245](https://github.com/near/NEPs/blob/master/neps/nep-0245.md)) from the intents contract to a given to an external account id (external being outside of intents).

If `msg` is given, `mt_batch_transfer_call()` will be used to transfer to the `receiver_id`. Otherwise, `mt_batch_transfer()` will be used.

min_gas.description:
Optional minimum required Near gas for created Promise to succeed per token: * `mt_batch_transfer`:      minimum: 20TGas, default: 20TGas * `mt_batch_transfer_call`: minimum: 35TGas, default: 50TGas

Remaining gas will be distributed evenly across all Function Call Promises created during execution of current receipt.

msg.description: Message to pass to `mt_batch_transfer_call`. Otherwise, `mt_batch_transfer` will be used. NOTE: No refund will be made in case of insufficient `storage_deposit` on `token` for `receiver_id`

MultiPayload.description:
Assuming wallets want to interact with Intents protocol, besides preparing the data in a certain form, they have to have the capability to sign raw messages (off-chain signatures) using an algorithm we understand. This enum solves that problem.

For example, because we support ERC-191 and know how to verify messages with that standard, we can allow wallets, like Metamask, sign messages to perform intents without having to support new cryptographic primitives and signing standards.

oneOf.description: NEP-413: The standard for message signing in Near Protocol. For more details, refer to [NEP-413](https://github.com/near/NEPs/blob/master/neps/nep-0413.md).

This is a unique, syntactically valid, human-readable account identifier on the NEAR network.

[See the crate-level docs for information about validation.](index.html#account-id-rules)

Also see [Error kind precedence](AccountId#error-kind-precedence).

## Examples

``` use near_account_id::AccountId;

let alice: AccountId = "alice.near".parse().unwrap();

assert!("ƒelicia.near".parse::<AccountId>().is_err()); // (ƒ is not f) ```

storage_deposit.description: Optionally make `storage_deposit` for `receiver_id` on `token`. The amount will be subtracted from user's NEP-141 `wNEAR` balance. NOTE: the `wNEAR` will not be refunded in case of fail

attached_deposit.description:
Optionally, attach deposit to [`.on_auth`](::defuse_auth_call::AuthCallee::on_auth) call. The amount will be subtracted from user's NEP-141 `wNEAR` balance.

NOTE: the `wNEAR` will not be refunded in case of fail.

contract_id.description: Callee for [`.on_auth`](::defuse_auth_call::AuthCallee::on_auth)

min_gas.description:
Optional minimum gas required for created promise to succeed. By default, only [`MIN_GAS_DEFAULT`](AuthCall::MIN_GAS_DEFAULT) is required.

Remaining gas will be distributed evenly across all Function Call Promises created during execution of current receipt.

msg.description: `msg` to pass in [`.on_auth`](::defuse_auth_call::AuthCallee::on_auth)

state_init.description: Optionally initialize the receiver's contract (Deterministic AccountId) via [`state_init`](https://github.com/near/NEPs/blob/master/neps/nep-0616.md#stateinit-action) right before calling [`.on_auth()`](::defuse_auth_call::AuthCallee::on_auth) (in the same receipt).

oneOf.description: Mint a set of tokens from the signer to a specified account id, within the intents contract.

min_gas.description:
Minimum gas for `mt_on_transfer()`

Remaining gas will be distributed evenly across all Function Call Promises created during execution of current receipt.

msg.description: Message to pass to `mt_on_transfer`

receiver_id.description: Receiver of the minted tokens

state_init.description: Optionally initialize the receiver's contract (Deterministic AccountId) via [`state_init`](https://github.com/near/NEPs/blob/master/neps/nep-0616.md#stateinit-action) right before calling `mt_on_transfer()` (in the same receipt).

tokens.description: The token_ids will be wrapped to bind the token ID to the minter authority (i.e. signer of this intent). The final string representation of the token will be as follows: `imt:<minter_id>:<token_id>`

intents.description: Sequence of intents to execute in given order. Empty list is also a valid sequence, i.e. it doesn't do anything, but still invalidates the `nonce` for the signer WARNING: Promises created by different intents are executed concurrently and does not rely on the order of the intents in this structure

min_gas.description:
Optional minimum required Near gas for created Promise to succeed: * `ft_transfer`:      minimum: 15TGas, default: 15TGas * `ft_transfer_call`: minimum: 30TGas, default: 50TGas

Remaining gas will be distributed evenly across all Function Call Promises created during execution of current receipt.

msg.description: Message to pass to `ft_transfer_call`. Otherwise, `ft_transfer` will be used. NOTE: No refund will be made in case of insufficient `storage_deposit` on `token` for `receiver_id`

oneOf.description: [COSE ES256 (-7) algorithm](https://www.iana.org/assignments/cose/cose.xhtml#algorithms): NIST P-256 curve (a.k.a secp256r1) over SHA-256
TonConnect: The standard for data signing in TON blockchain platform. For more details, refer to [TonConnect documentation](https://docs.tonconsole.com/academy/sign-data).

address.description: Wallet address in either [Raw](https://docs.ton.org/v3/documentation/smart-contracts/addresses/address-formats#raw-address) representation or [user-friendly](https://docs.ton.org/v3/documentation/smart-contracts/addresses/address-formats#user-friendly-address) format

NativeWithdraw.description: Withdraw native tokens (NEAR) from the intents contract to a given external account id (external being outside of intents). This will subtract from the account's wNEAR balance, and will be sent to the account specified as native NEAR. NOTE: the `wNEAR` will not be refunded in case of fail (e.g. `receiver_id` account does not exist).

PermissionedAccounts.description:
Collects super admin accounts and accounts that have been granted permissions defined by `AccessControlRole`.

# Data structure

Assume `AccessControlRole` is derived for the following enum, which is then passed as `role` attribute to `AccessControllable`.

```rust pub enum Role { PauseManager, UnpauseManager, } ```

Then the returned data has the following structure:

```ignore PermissionedAccounts { super_admins: vec!["acc1.near", "acc2.near"], roles: HashMap::from([ ("PauseManager", PermissionedAccountsPerRole { admins: vec!["acc3.near", "acc4.near"], grantees: vec!["acc5.near", "acc6.near"], }), ("UnpauseManager", PermissionedAccountsPerRole { admins: vec!["acc7.near", "acc8.near"], grantees: vec!["acc9.near", "acc10.near"], }), ]) } ```

# Uniqueness and ordering

Account ids returned in vectors are unique but not ordered.

roles.description: The admins and grantees of all roles.

additionalProperties.description:
Collects all admins and grantees of a role.

# Uniqueness and ordering

Account ids returned in vectors are unique but not ordered.

admins.description: The accounts that have admin permissions for the role.

StorageDeposit.description:
Make [NEP-145](https://nomicon.io/Standards/StorageManagement#nep-145) `storage_deposit` for an `account_id` on `contract_id`. The `amount` will be subtracted from user's NEP-141 `wNEAR` balance. NOTE: the `wNEAR` will not be refunded in any case.

WARNING: use this intent only if paying storage_deposit is not a prerequisite for other intents to succeed. If some intent (e.g. ft_withdraw) requires storage_deposit, then use storage_deposit field of corresponding intent instead of adding a separate `StorageDeposit` intent. This is due to the fact that intents that fire `Promise`s are not guaranteed to be executed sequentially, in the order of the provided intents in `DefuseIntents`.

attached_deposit.description:

NOTE: the `wNEAR` will not be refunded in case of fail.

MultiPayloadNep413.description: NEP-413: The standard for message signing in Near Protocol. For more details, refer to [NEP-413](https://github.com/near/NEPs/blob/master/neps/nep-0413.md).

MultiPayloadErc191.description: ERC-191: The standard for message signing in Ethereum, commonly used with `personal_sign()`. For more details, refer to [EIP-191](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-191).

signature.description: There is no public key member because the public key can be recovered via `ecrecover()` knowing the data and the signature. Encoding: base58

MultiPayloadTip191.description: TIP-191: The standard for message signing in Tron. For more details, refer to [TIP-191](https://github.com/tronprotocol/tips/blob/master/tip-191.md).

signature.description: There is no public key member because the public key can be recovered via `ecrecover()` knowing the data and the signature. Encoding: base58

MultiPayloadRawEd25519.description: Raw Ed25519: The standard used by Solana Phantom wallets for message signing. For more details, refer to [Phantom Wallet's documentation](https://docs.phantom.com/solana/signing-a-message).

MultiPayloadWebauthn.description: [COSE ES256 (-7) algorithm](https://www.iana.org/assignments/cose/cose.xhtml#algorithms): NIST P-256 curve (a.k.a secp256r1) over SHA-256

MultiPayloadTonConnect.description: TonConnect: The standard for data signing in TON blockchain platform. For more details, refer to [TonConnect documentation](https://docs.tonconsole.com/academy/sign-data).

address.description: Wallet address in either [Raw](https://docs.ton.org/v3/documentation/smart-contracts/addresses/address-formats#raw-address) representation or [user-friendly](https://docs.ton.org/v3/documentation/smart-contracts/addresses/address-formats#user-friendly-address) format

timestamp.description: UNIX timestamp (in seconds or RFC3339) at the time of singing

MultiPayloadSep53.description: SEP-53: The standard for signing data off-chain for Stellar accounts. See [SEP-53](https://github.com/stellar/stellar-protocol/blob/master/ecosystem/sep-0053.md)

[See the crate-level docs for information about validation.](index.html#account-id-rules)

Also see [Error kind precedence](AccountId#error-kind-precedence).

## Examples

``` use near_account_id::AccountId;

let alice: AccountId = "alice.near".parse().unwrap();

assert!("ƒelicia.near".parse::<AccountId>().is_err()); // (ƒ is not f) ```

attached_deposit.description:
Optionally, attach deposit to [`.on_auth`](::defuse_auth_call::AuthCallee::on_auth) call. The amount will be subtracted from user's NEP-141 `wNEAR` balance.

NOTE: the `wNEAR` will not be refunded in case of fail.

contract_id.description: Callee for [`.on_auth`](::defuse_auth_call::AuthCallee::on_auth)

min_gas.description:
Optional minimum gas required for created promise to succeed. By default, only [`MIN_GAS_DEFAULT`](AuthCall::MIN_GAS_DEFAULT) is required.

Remaining gas will be distributed evenly across all Function Call Promises created during execution of current receipt.

msg.description: `msg` to pass in [`.on_auth`](::defuse_auth_call::AuthCallee::on_auth)

state_init.description: Optionally initialize the receiver's contract (Deterministic AccountId) via [`state_init`](https://github.com/near/NEPs/blob/master/neps/nep-0616.md#stateinit-action) right before calling [`.on_auth()`](::defuse_auth_call::AuthCallee::on_auth) (in the same receipt).

min_gas.description:
Optional minimum required Near gas for created Promise to succeed: * `ft_transfer`:      minimum: 15TGas, default: 15TGas * `ft_transfer_call`: minimum: 30TGas, default: 50TGas

Remaining gas will be distributed evenly across all Function Call Promises created during execution of current receipt.

msg.description: Message to pass to `ft_transfer_call`. Otherwise, `ft_transfer` will be used. NOTE: No refund will be made in case of insufficient `storage_deposit` on `token` for `receiver_id`

attached_deposit.description:
Optionally, attach deposit to [`.on_auth`](::defuse_auth_call::AuthCallee::on_auth) call. The amount will be subtracted from user's NEP-141 `wNEAR` balance.

NOTE: the `wNEAR` will not be refunded in case of fail.

Remaining gas will be distributed evenly across all Function Call Promises created during execution of current receipt.

This is a unique, syntactically valid, human-readable account identifier on the NEAR network.

[See the crate-level docs for information about validation.](index.html#account-id-rules)

Also see [Error kind precedence](AccountId#error-kind-precedence).

## Examples

``` use near_account_id::AccountId;

let alice: AccountId = "alice.near".parse().unwrap();

assert!("ƒelicia.near".parse::<AccountId>().is_err()); // (ƒ is not f) ```

attached_deposit.description:
Optionally, attach deposit to [`.on_auth`](::defuse_auth_call::AuthCallee::on_auth) call. The amount will be subtracted from user's NEP-141 `wNEAR` balance.

NOTE: the `wNEAR` will not be refunded in case of fail.

contract_id.description: Callee for [`.on_auth`](::defuse_auth_call::AuthCallee::on_auth)

min_gas.description:
Optional minimum gas required for created promise to succeed. By default, only [`MIN_GAS_DEFAULT`](AuthCall::MIN_GAS_DEFAULT) is required.

Remaining gas will be distributed evenly across all Function Call Promises created during execution of current receipt.

msg.description: `msg` to pass in [`.on_auth`](::defuse_auth_call::AuthCallee::on_auth)

state_init.description: Optionally initialize the receiver's contract (Deterministic AccountId) via [`state_init`](https://github.com/near/NEPs/blob/master/neps/nep-0616.md#stateinit-action) right before calling [`.on_auth()`](::defuse_auth_call::AuthCallee::on_auth) (in the same receipt).

account_id.description:

## Examples

assert!("ƒelicia.near".parse::<AccountId>().is_err()); // (ƒ is not f) ```

oneOf.description: Mint a set of tokens from the signer to a specified account id, within the intents contract.

min_gas.description:
Minimum gas for `mt_on_transfer()`

Remaining gas will be distributed evenly across all Function Call Promises created during execution of current receipt.

msg.description: Message to pass to `mt_on_transfer`

receiver_id.description: Receiver of the minted tokens

state_init.description: Optionally initialize the receiver's contract (Deterministic AccountId) via [`state_init`](https://github.com/near/NEPs/blob/master/neps/nep-0616.md#stateinit-action) right before calling `mt_on_transfer()` (in the same receipt).

account_id.description:

tokens.description: The token_ids will be wrapped to bind the token ID to the minter authority (i.e. signer of this intent). The final string representation of the token will be as follows: `imt:<minter_id>:<token_id>`

oneOf.description: Burn a set of imt tokens, within the intents contract.

intents.description: Sequence of intents to execute in given order. Empty list is also a valid sequence, i.e. it doesn't do anything, but still invalidates the `nonce` for the signer WARNING: Promises created by different intents are executed concurrently and does not rely on the order of the intents in this structure

Minimum gas for `mt_on_transfer()`

Remaining gas will be distributed evenly across all Function Call Promises created during execution of current receipt.

msg.description: Message to pass to `mt_on_transfer`

account_id.description:
NEAR Account Identifier.

This is a unique, syntactically valid, human-readable account identifier on the NEAR network.

[See the crate-level docs for information about validation.](index.html#account-id-rules)

Also see [Error kind precedence](AccountId#error-kind-precedence).

## Examples

``` use near_account_id::AccountId;

assert!("ƒelicia.near".parse::<AccountId>().is_err()); // (ƒ is not f) ```

min_gas.description:
Optional minimum required Near gas for created Promise to succeed: * `ft_transfer`:      minimum: 15TGas, default: 15TGas * `ft_transfer_call`: minimum: 30TGas, default: 50TGas

Remaining gas will be distributed evenly across all Function Call Promises created during execution of current receipt.

msg.description: Message to pass to `ft_transfer_call`. Otherwise, `ft_transfer` will be used. NOTE: No refund will be made in case of insufficient `storage_deposit` on `token` for `receiver_id`

receiver_id.description:
NEAR Account Identifier.

This is a unique, syntactically valid, human-readable account identifier on the NEAR network.

[See the crate-level docs for information about validation.](index.html#account-id-rules)

## Examples

``` use near_account_id::AccountId;

assert!("ƒelicia.near".parse::<AccountId>().is_err()); // (ƒ is not f) ```

storage_deposit.description: Optionally make `storage_deposit` for `receiver_id` on `token`. The amount will be subtracted from user's NEP-141 `wNEAR` balance. NOTE: the `wNEAR` will not be refunded in case of fail

NOTE: the `wNEAR` will not be refunded in case of fail.

state_init.description: Optionally initialize the receiver's contract (Deterministic AccountId) via [`state_init`](https://github.com/near/NEPs/blob/master/neps/nep-0616.md#stateinit-action) right before calling [`.on_auth()`](::defuse_auth_call::AuthCallee::on_auth) (in the same receipt).

attached_deposit.description:
Optionally, attach deposit to [`.on_auth`](::defuse_auth_call::AuthCallee::on_auth) call. The amount will be subtracted from user's NEP-141 `wNEAR` balance.

NOTE: the `wNEAR` will not be refunded in case of fail.

min_gas.description:

Remaining gas will be distributed evenly across all Function Call Promises created during execution of current receipt.

msg.description: `msg` to pass in [`.on_auth`](::defuse_auth_call::AuthCallee::on_auth)

state_init.description: Optionally initialize the receiver's contract (Deterministic AccountId) via [`state_init`](https://github.com/near/NEPs/blob/master/neps/nep-0616.md#stateinit-action) right before calling [`.on_auth()`](::defuse_auth_call::AuthCallee::on_auth) (in the same receipt).

NOTE: the `wNEAR` will not be refunded in case of fail.

contract_id.description: Callee for [`.on_auth`](::defuse_auth_call::AuthCallee::on_auth)

min_gas.description:
Optional minimum gas required for created promise to succeed. By default, only [`MIN_GAS_DEFAULT`](AuthCall::MIN_GAS_DEFAULT) is required.

Remaining gas will be distributed evenly across all Function Call Promises created during execution of current receipt.

msg.description: `msg` to pass in [`.on_auth`](::defuse_auth_call::AuthCallee::on_auth)

state_init.description: Optionally initialize the receiver's contract (Deterministic AccountId) via [`state_init`](https://github.com/near/NEPs/blob/master/neps/nep-0616.md#stateinit-action) right before calling [`.on_auth()`](::defuse_auth_call::AuthCallee::on_auth) (in the same receipt).

account_id.description:
NEAR Account Identifier.

This is a unique, syntactically valid, human-readable account identifier on the NEAR network.

[See the crate-level docs for information about validation.](index.html#account-id-rules)

Also see [Error kind precedence](AccountId#error-kind-precedence).

## Examples

``` use near_account_id::AccountId;

let alice: AccountId = "alice.near".parse().unwrap();

assert!("ƒelicia.near".parse::<AccountId>().is_err()); // (ƒ is not f) ```

oneOf.description: Mint a set of tokens from the signer to a specified account id, within the intents contract.

min_gas.description:
Minimum gas for `mt_on_transfer()`

Remaining gas will be distributed evenly across all Function Call Promises created during execution of current receipt.

msg.description: Message to pass to `mt_on_transfer`

receiver_id.description: Receiver of the minted tokens

state_init.description: Optionally initialize the receiver's contract (Deterministic AccountId) via [`state_init`](https://github.com/near/NEPs/blob/master/neps/nep-0616.md#stateinit-action) right before calling `mt_on_transfer()` (in the same receipt).

tokens.description: The token_ids will be wrapped to bind the token ID to the minter authority (i.e. signer of this intent). The final string representation of the token will be as follows: `imt:<minter_id>:<token_id>`

oneOf.description: Burn a set of imt tokens, within the intents contract.

signature.description: There is no public key member because the public key can be recovered via `ecrecover()` knowing the data and the signature. Encoding: base58

oneOf.description: Raw Ed25519: The standard used by Solana Phantom wallets for message signing. For more details, refer to [Phantom Wallet's documentation](https://docs.phantom.com/solana/signing-a-message).

intents.description: Sequence of intents to execute in given order. Empty list is also a valid sequence, i.e. it doesn't do anything, but still invalidates the `nonce` for the signer WARNING: Promises created by different intents are executed concurrently and does not rely on the order of the intents in this structure

Remaining gas will be distributed evenly across all Function Call Promises created during execution of current receipt.

msg.description: Message to pass to `mt_on_transfer`

min_gas.description:
Optional minimum required Near gas for created Promise to succeed: * `ft_transfer`:      minimum: 15TGas, default: 15TGas * `ft_transfer_call`: minimum: 30TGas, default: 50TGas

Remaining gas will be distributed evenly across all Function Call Promises created during execution of current receipt.

msg.description: Message to pass to `ft_transfer_call`. Otherwise, `ft_transfer` will be used. NOTE: No refund will be made in case of insufficient `storage_deposit` on `token` for `receiver_id`

NOTE: the `wNEAR` will not be refunded in case of fail.

min_gas.description:

Remaining gas will be distributed evenly across all Function Call Promises created during execution of current receipt.

msg.description: `msg` to pass in [`.on_auth`](::defuse_auth_call::AuthCallee::on_auth)

state_init.description: Optionally initialize the receiver's contract (Deterministic AccountId) via [`state_init`](https://github.com/near/NEPs/blob/master/neps/nep-0616.md#stateinit-action) right before calling [`.on_auth()`](::defuse_auth_call::AuthCallee::on_auth) (in the same receipt).

Optionally, attach deposit to [`.on_auth`](::defuse_auth_call::AuthCallee::on_auth) call. The amount will be subtracted from user's NEP-141 `wNEAR` balance.

NOTE: the `wNEAR` will not be refunded in case of fail.

min_gas.description:
Optional minimum gas required for created promise to succeed. By default, only [`MIN_GAS_DEFAULT`](AuthCall::MIN_GAS_DEFAULT) is required.

Remaining gas will be distributed evenly across all Function Call Promises created during execution of current receipt.

msg.description: `msg` to pass in [`.on_auth`](::defuse_auth_call::AuthCallee::on_auth)

state_init.description: Optionally initialize the receiver's contract (Deterministic AccountId) via [`state_init`](https://github.com/near/NEPs/blob/master/neps/nep-0616.md#stateinit-action) right before calling [`.on_auth()`](::defuse_auth_call::AuthCallee::on_auth) (in the same receipt).

NOTE: the `wNEAR` will not be refunded in case of fail.

contract_id.description: Callee for [`.on_auth`](::defuse_auth_call::AuthCallee::on_auth)

min_gas.description:
Optional minimum gas required for created promise to succeed. By default, only [`MIN_GAS_DEFAULT`](AuthCall::MIN_GAS_DEFAULT) is required.

Remaining gas will be distributed evenly across all Function Call Promises created during execution of current receipt.

msg.description: `msg` to pass in [`.on_auth`](::defuse_auth_call::AuthCallee::on_auth)

state_init.description: Optionally initialize the receiver's contract (Deterministic AccountId) via [`state_init`](https://github.com/near/NEPs/blob/master/neps/nep-0616.md#stateinit-action) right before calling [`.on_auth()`](::defuse_auth_call::AuthCallee::on_auth) (in the same receipt).

account_id.description:
NEAR Account Identifier.

This is a unique, syntactically valid, human-readable account identifier on the NEAR network.

[See the crate-level docs for information about validation.](index.html#account-id-rules)

Also see [Error kind precedence](AccountId#error-kind-precedence).

## Examples

``` use near_account_id::AccountId;

let alice: AccountId = "alice.near".parse().unwrap();

assert!("ƒelicia.near".parse::<AccountId>().is_err()); // (ƒ is not f) ```

oneOf.description: Mint a set of tokens from the signer to a specified account id, within the intents contract.

min_gas.description:
Minimum gas for `mt_on_transfer()`

Remaining gas will be distributed evenly across all Function Call Promises created during execution of current receipt.

msg.description: Message to pass to `mt_on_transfer`

receiver_id.description: Receiver of the minted tokens

state_init.description: Optionally initialize the receiver's contract (Deterministic AccountId) via [`state_init`](https://github.com/near/NEPs/blob/master/neps/nep-0616.md#stateinit-action) right before calling `mt_on_transfer()` (in the same receipt).

account_id.description:

tokens.description: The token_ids will be wrapped to bind the token ID to the minter authority (i.e. signer of this intent). The final string representation of the token will be as follows: `imt:<minter_id>:<token_id>`

oneOf.description: Burn a set of imt tokens, within the intents contract.

intents.description: Sequence of intents to execute in given order. Empty list is also a valid sequence, i.e. it doesn't do anything, but still invalidates the `nonce` for the signer WARNING: Promises created by different intents are executed concurrently and does not rely on the order of the intents in this structure

min_gas.description:
Optional minimum required Near gas for created Promise to succeed: * `ft_transfer`:      minimum: 15TGas, default: 15TGas * `ft_transfer_call`: minimum: 30TGas, default: 50TGas

Remaining gas will be distributed evenly across all Function Call Promises created during execution of current receipt.

msg.description: Message to pass to `ft_transfer_call`. Otherwise, `ft_transfer` will be used. NOTE: No refund will be made in case of insufficient `storage_deposit` on `token` for `receiver_id`

storage_deposit.description: Optionally make `storage_deposit` for `receiver_id` on `token`. The amount will be subtracted from user's NEP-141 `wNEAR` balance. NOTE: the `wNEAR` will not be refunded in case of fail

contract_id.description: Callee for [`.on_auth`](::defuse_auth_call::AuthCallee::on_auth)

min_gas.description:
Optional minimum gas required for created promise to succeed. By default, only [`MIN_GAS_DEFAULT`](AuthCall::MIN_GAS_DEFAULT) is required.

Remaining gas will be distributed evenly across all Function Call Promises created during execution of current receipt.

msg.description: `msg` to pass in [`.on_auth`](::defuse_auth_call::AuthCallee::on_auth)

state_init.description: Optionally initialize the receiver's contract (Deterministic AccountId) via [`state_init`](https://github.com/near/NEPs/blob/master/neps/nep-0616.md#stateinit-action) right before calling [`.on_auth()`](::defuse_auth_call::AuthCallee::on_auth) (in the same receipt).

account_id.description:
NEAR Account Identifier.

This is a unique, syntactically valid, human-readable account identifier on the NEAR network.

[See the crate-level docs for information about validation.](index.html#account-id-rules)

Also see [Error kind precedence](AccountId#error-kind-precedence).

## Examples

``` use near_account_id::AccountId;

let alice: AccountId = "alice.near".parse().unwrap();

assert!("ƒelicia.near".parse::<AccountId>().is_err()); // (ƒ is not f) ```
